metadata.title: CVE-2016-5832 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
The customizer in WordPress before 4.5.3 allows remote attackers to bypassintended redirection restrictions via unspecified vectors.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-5832` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

wordpress - 4.5.3+dfsg-1
wordpress-l10n - 4.5.3+dfsg-1
wordpress-theme-twentynineteen - 4.5.3+dfsg-1
wordpress-theme-twentyseventeen - 4.5.3+dfsg-1
wordpress-theme-twentysixteen - 4.5.3+dfsg-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wordpress package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.5.3+dfsg-1').
